title: stork-configuration-generator 2.0.z gives java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: jakarta/enterprise/inject/spi/CDI: jakarta.enterprise.inject.spi.CDI

labels.name: triage/upstream
labels.description: Used for issues which are caused by issues in upstream projects/dependency

body:
### Describe the bug

stork-configuration-generator 2.0.z gives java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: jakarta/enterprise/inject/spi/CDI: jakarta.enterprise.inject.spi.CDI 

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.11.0:compile (default-compile) on project stork-custom: Fatal error compiling: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: jakarta/enterprise/inject/spi/CDI: jakarta.enterprise.inject.spi.CDI -> [Help 1]
org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.11.0:compile (default-compile) on project stork-custom: Fatal error compiling
...
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: jakarta/enterprise/inject/spi/CDI
    at io.smallrye.stork.config.generator.ConfigClassWriter.createLoadBalancerLoader (ConfigClassWriter.java:84)
    at io.smallrye.stork.config.generator.ConfigurationGenerator.writeLoadBalancerConfigs (ConfigurationGenerator.java:235)
    at io.smallrye.stork.config.generator.ConfigurationGenerator.process (ConfigurationGenerator.java:69)
    at com.sun.tools.javac.processing.JavacProcessingEnvironment.callProcessor (JavacProcessingEnvironment.java:1023)
    at com.sun.tools.javac.processing.JavacProcessingEnvironment.discoverAndRunProcs (JavacProcessingEnvironment.java:939)
```

The problem is that stork moved to Jakarta, but maven tooling is using javax.

https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/io.smallrye.stork/stork-configuration-generator/2.0.1 defines dependency on `jakarta.enterprise.cdi-api` as optional

I think we should consider making this dependency mandatory, or at least update the docs - stork-reference guide.
Or the processor should move back to javax based cdi-api.

My workaround is to define jakarta api dependency:
```xml
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>${compiler-plugin.version}</version>
                <configuration>
                    <annotationProcessorPaths>
                        <path>
                            <groupId>io.smallrye.stork</groupId>
                            <artifactId>stork-configuration-generator</artifactId>
                            <version>${smallrye-stork.version}</version>
                        </path>
                        <path>
                            <groupId>jakarta.enterprise</groupId>
                            <artifactId>jakarta.enterprise.cdi-api</artifactId>
                            <version>4.0.1</version>
                        </path>
                    </annotationProcessorPaths>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
```

### Expected behavior

Application compiles without error

### Actual behavior

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.11.0:compile (default-compile) on project stork-custom: Fatal error compiling: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: jakarta/enterprise/inject/spi/CDI: jakarta.enterprise.inject.spi.CDI -> [Help 1]

### How to Reproduce?

get https://github.com/quarkus-qe/quarkus-test-suite

run `mvn -e clean verify -f service-discovery/stork-custom -Dsmallrye-stork.version=2.0.1`

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

macOS 13.2 Ventura

### Output of `java -version`

Java 17

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

Quarkus main

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
